raw_text:
Santy worm makes unwelcome visit
 
 Thousands of website bulletin boards have been defaced by a virus that used Google to spread across the net.
 
 The Santy worm first appeared on 20 December and within 24 hours had successfully hit more than 40,000 websites. The malicious program exploits a vulnerability in the widely used phpBB software. Santy's spread has now been stopped after Google began blocking infected sites searching for new victims.
 
 The worm replaces chat forums with a webpage announcing that the site had been defaced by the malicious program. Soon after being infected, sites hit by the worm started randomly searching for other websites running the vulnerable phpBB software. Once Google started blocking these search queries the rate of infection tailed off sharply. A message sent to Finnish security firm F-Secure by Google's security team said: "While a seven hour response for something like this is not outrageous, we think we can and should do better." "We will be reviewing our procedures to improve our response time in the future to similar problems," the Google team said. Security firms estimate that about 1m websites run their discussion groups and forums with the open source phpBB program. The worst of the attack now seems to be over as a search conducted on the morning of the 22 December produced only 1,440 hits for sites showing the text used in the defacement message. People using the sites hit by Santy will not be affected by the worm. Santy is not the first malicious program to use Google to help it spread. In July a variant of the MyDoom virus slowed down searches on Google as the program flooded the search site with queries looking for new e-mail addresses to send itself to.
llama3.2:1b:
Thousands of website bulletin boards have been defaced by a virus that used Google to spread across the net, exploiting a vulnerability in phpBB software. The Santy worm hit more than 40,000 sites within 24 hours and was stopped after Google blocked infected sites searching for new victims. The worm replaced chat forums with a webpage announcing site defacement, but once Google blocked search queries on similar vulnerabilities, the rate of infection sharply declined. 

Approximately 1 million websites run phpBB discussion groups and forums. Santy is not the first malicious program to use Google to spread, as it was part of a variant of MyDoom that slowed down searches on Google in July.
llama3.2:3b: A Santy worm defaced thousands of website bulletin boards in 24 hours by exploiting a phpBB software vulnerability, spreading through Google search queries. Google blocked infected sites' searches, slowing the infection rate. The worst of the attack seems over, with only 1440 hits remaining for defacement messages.
gemma2:2b: A virus called Santy defaced thousands of websites using phpBB software vulnerability. The worm rapidly infected websites, but Google blocked its search queries, stopping further spread. The attack affected roughly 1 million websites running phpBB.  Santy is not the first program to use Google for spreading; MyDoom in July slowed down Google searches by flooding it with queries for new email addresses.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The Santy worm made its way onto thousands of websites, disrupting 40,000 sites within 24 hours and having been stopped by Google's blocking of infected sites. The worm replaces chat forums with a webpage announcing the defacement, and soon after it started searching for other vulnerable phpBB software sites. Security firms estimate that about 1 million websites use this open-source forum software.
qwen2.5:1.5b: A computer virus that uses Google to spread has infected 40,000 websites and defaced thousands of bulletin boards; it's been stopped by Google blocking infected sites searching for victims. The worm replaces chat forums with a webpage announcing the site was defaced; the malware infects vulnerable phpBB software on over 1 million web forums worldwide, which are now safe from Santy but not MyDoom virus variants that flood Google with queries to find new targets.
qwen2.5:3b: Thousands of website bulletin boards were defaced by the Santy worm, which exploited a phpBB vulnerability. The worm spread rapidly within 24 hours after appearing on December 20th, affecting over 40,000 sites. Google stopped its spread by blocking infected sites searching for new victims. Once Google began blocking these queries, the infection rate decreased sharply. About 1m websites use phpBB software. Santy is not the first program to leverage Google for spreading; in July, MyDoom variant slowed down Google searches by flooding it with spam queries. The worst of the attack now seems over as few sites showed defacement messages on December 22nd. Users affected by infected sites will not be impacted by the worm itself.
opencoder:1.5b: Santy worm makes unwelcome visit Thousands of website bulletin boards have been defaced by a virus that used Google to spread across the net The malicious program exploits a vulnerability in the widely used phpBB software Santy's spread has now been stopped after Google began blocking infected sites searching for new victims The worm replaces chat forums with a webpage announcing that the site had been defaced by the malicious program Soon after being infected, sites hit by the worm started randomly searching for other websites running the vulnerable phpBB software Once Google started blocking these search queries the rate of infection tailed off sharply A message sent to Finnish security firm F-Secure by Google's security team said "While a seven hour response for something like this is not outrageous, we think we can and should do better." We will be reviewing our procedures to improve our response time in the future to similar problems. Security firms estimate that about 1m websites run their discussion groups and forums with the open source phpBB program The worst of the attack now seems to be over as a search conducted on the morning of the 22 December produced only 1,440 hits for sites showing the text used in the defacement message. People using the sites hit by Santy will not be affected by the worm In July a variant of the MyDoom virus slowed down searches on Google as the program flooded the search site with queries looking for new e-mail addresses to send itself to.
smollm:1.7b:
The summary should be:
A worm that exploited a vulnerability in phpBB software was used to infect thousands of websites, causing widespread damage and disruption. The worm spread rapidly across the internet, using Google's search functionality to announce its presence and redirect users to infected sites. The worm replaced chat forums with a webpage announcing that the site had been defaced by the malicious program. Once Google blocked these search queries, the rate of infection tailed off sharply as the malware was no longer able to spread quickly through the internet. A message sent to Finnish security firm F-Secure by Google's security team said: "While a seven hour response for something like this is not outrageous, we think we can and should do better." The security firms estimate that about 1m websites run their discussion groups and forums with the open source phpBB program. The worst of the attack now seems to be over as a search conducted on the morning of the 22 December produced only 1,440 hits for sites showing the text used in the defacement message. People using the sites hit by Santy will not be affected by the worm. Users who use these sites will not be able to access them because they are no longer running on vulnerable phpBB software.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize the given text concisely while preserving key ideas and details. Let me read through the text first.

The main event is a virus called Santy that defaced many website boards by exploiting PHPBB software. It started on December 20, hit over 40k websites within 24 hours, then stopped when Google blocked them after starting to search for other sites running phpBB.

I should mention the spread process and how Santy replaces forums with a message about a defaced site. Also, note that once blocked, the attack stopped. Then, there's information from Google about their response and some security firm estimates on website usage. Finally, compare Santy to MyDoom, which did similar things but didn't stop entirely.

I need to make sure I cover all these points without adding extra details beyond what's in the text.
</think>

Thousands of website forums were disrupted by a virus called Santy, exploiting PHPBB software. It first appeared on December 20 and quickly targeted over 40,000 websites within 24 hours. Once infected, sites started randomly searching for other phpBB users, causing Google to block their searches after defacing a site they were trying to access. A message from Google's security team suggested they would review their response protocols. Security firms estimated that about a million sites use phpBB for forums. After the attack, no significant website was affected by Santy. Additionally, another virus, MyDoom, did not stop search results but caused slower responses when it flooded users looking for new email addresses.
tinyllama:1.1b: Several thousand websites were affected by a malicious program, named Santy, that spread across the internet using Google to find and infect sites with it. The virus exploited a vulnerability in the widely used phpBB software, causing defacements of chat forums and random seaosn of infestation after being infected by the worm. With Google blocking new victims, the rate of infestations began to tail off in a seven-hour response, estimated at approximately 1 million websites running the open source phpBB program. Security experts believe that the worst of the attack is over and that people using sites hit by Santy will not be affected by the worm. However, the software exploited a vulnerability in the popular search engine's web server code to flood it with queries looking for new e-mail addresses to send itself to.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
The worm, Santy, has caused havoc across the internet, infecting more than 40,000 websites and defacing them with a message that says they have been defaced by the malicious program. Santy is thought to be using an open-source software in its creation, causing chaos for both website owners and antivirus companies as it replaces chat forums with a message announcing that the site has been infected. Google has taken down millions of search queries directed at affected sites, which have reportedly been running the vulnerable phpBB software. This has led to a significant reduction in the rate of infectivity, suggesting that the problem might be over.

Despite its efforts to improve its response time in similar situations, Google has been criticized for taking an "us-versus-them" approach, with security firms estimating that about 1 million websites run their discussion groups and forums with the open source phpBB program. The worst of the attack seems to be over as only a few hundred search queries are being reported per hour. The worm is not thought to have infected anyone who used the sites hit by Santy, as they were running a different open-source software.
phi:2.7b: Thousands of websites were defaced by a virus that used Google to spread across the net. The Santy worm first appeared in December, affected over 40,000 sites, and exploited a vulnerability in the phpBB software. However, after Google started blocking infected search queries, the rate of infection slowed down significantly. The attack is estimated at affecting around 1m websites that use the open source phpBB program.
orca-mini:3b: The Santy worm was a virus that caused defacements on thousands of website bulletin boards in 24 hours. It exploited a vulnerability in phpBB software and used Google to spread across the net. After being stopped, the worm randomly searched for other websites running the vulnerable phpBB software. Google's security team said they will review their procedures to improve response time.
hermes3:3b: Santy worm defaces 40000 websites within 24h, exploiting phpBB vulnerability; spreads via random search of vulnerable sites, eventually stopped by Google blocking infected sites.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: A virus called Santy infected thousands of websites by exploiting a vulnerability in phpBB software. It appeared on 20 December and within 24 hours, had affected over 40,000 sites. Google began blocking infected sites, slowing down the rate of infection. About 1 million websites run discussion groups and forums with phpBB program. The worst of the attack seems to be over, and people using these sites won't be affected by Santy. This is not the first time a malicious program used Google to help spread itself; an earlier variant of MyDoom also slowed down searches on Google.
chatgpt-4o-latest: The Santy worm, which appeared on December 20, defaced thousands of website bulletin boards by exploiting a vulnerability in the widely used phpBB software. It spread rapidly by using Google searches to find new targets, infecting over 40,000 websites within 24 hours. The worm replaced chat forums with a defacement message and caused infected sites to search for others running phpBB. Google eventually blocked these search queries, significantly slowing the infection rate. Security firms estimate that around 1 million websites use phpBB, but the worst of the attack appears to be over. Google acknowledged the need to improve its response time to such threats. Santy is not the first virus to use Google for spreading, as a MyDoom variant previously exploited the search engine in a similar manner.
stablelm2:1.6b: A malware known as Santy worm hit thousands of website bulletin boards, spreading using Google's services. The worm exploited a vulnerability in phpBB software and quickly infected over 1 million websites by December. After Google began blocking infected sites searching for other victims, the rate of infection tailed off sharply. About 1 million websites run their discussion groups and forums with the open-source phpBB program. While there are still ~1 million websites infected, the worst appears to be behind us as searches on morning of December showed only 1 hit for sites showing the defacement message text. The worm does not affect people using these sites; however, security firms estimate that about 1 million websites run their discussion groups and forums with phpBB software.
granite3.1-dense:2b: The Santy worm, discovered on December 20, infected over 40,000 websites within 24 hours by exploiting a vulnerability in phpBB software. It replaced chat forums with defacement messages and initiated scans for other vulnerable phpBB sites. Google intervened by blocking these search queries, significantly reducing the infection rate. Estimated to affect 1 million websites globally, the worst of the attack ended on December 22 with only 1,440 hits. Santy is not unique; a similar MyDoom variant in July also hijacked Google searches for new email addresses.
reference: Santy is not the first malicious program to use Google to help it spread.Soon after being infected, sites hit by the worm started randomly searching for other websites running the vulnerable phpBB software.The worm replaces chat forums with a webpage announcing that the site had been defaced by the malicious program.In July a variant of the MyDoom virus slowed down searches on Google as the program flooded the search site with queries looking for new e-mail addresses to send itself to.People using the sites hit by Santy will not be affected by the worm.Santy's spread has now been stopped after Google began blocking infected sites searching for new victims.
